meanings.definition: To make less wild or unruly
meanings.sent1: She tames the playful puppy with gentle training.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper tames the fierce lion to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tames the chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: Patience tames even the wildest of tempers.
meanings.sent5: His soothing voice tames the storm of emotions within her.

meanings.sent1: He tames the wild horse by spending time with it daily.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often tame animals to help with work on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The clever parrot tames the audience with its impressive tricks.
meanings.sent4: Love tames even the most stubborn hearts.
meanings.sent5: Consistent practice tames the unruly mind.

meanings.sent1: She tames her impulses to avoid making hasty decisions.
meanings.sent2: The trainer tames the dog's behavior through positive reinforcement.
meanings.sent3: Laughter tames the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to tame the soul and uplift spirits.
meanings.sent5: His determination tames the challenges he faces.
